ygData.subject: Should Heritrix retry 503 Service Unavailable status codes?
ygData.msgSnippet: We have a large dynamic site being crawled with Heritrix (1.14.1) to create an archived version of the site. At times the site returns HTTP/1.0 503 Service

From: "b_b_hunter" <barry@...>
Subject: Should Heritrix retry 503 Service Unavailable status codes?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=187629258; y=_Iv-180oPJrvuZQA0dcpQsAlWNcDPf1rzt-kw69F12Pr-FR5WQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: b_b_hunter
X-YGroups-SubInfo: t=0;f=16;g=jbzx9-wZwAXR9AzjIlgi9zqpNLrgl_wj3-JDm0raWfj2_pPFxFBUtzPJbRUV_IwOPHY;
X-eGroups-Approved-By: stearcorg <steve@...> via web; 21 Sep 2009 16:57:49 -0000

We have a large dynamic site being crawled with Heritrix (1.14.1) to create=
 an archived version of the site. 

At times the site returns "HTTP/1.0 503=
 Service Unavailable" - when certain backend services are overloaded or oth=
erwise unavailable. 

However it seems that these 'error pages' are being c=
ached and written into the Archive. (this was noted in a test crawl, and th=
e fact that the urls are not retried) 

For the moment we have "bodged it" =
so in this case the script just sleep(30), which causes Heritrix to timeout=
 and retry the url later ;)

From reading the source code it appears no spe=
cial handling of error codes is done. For errors in the 5xx range would at =
least expect them to be retried in the same way that connection failures an=
d connection lost are? 

Thanks.
